Title:
A Large-Scale Empirical Study of
Just-in-Time Quality Assurance
Elements_risk_assessment:
identify the most recent revision in which the modified was changed
    using the annotate command and we label the change of the identified revision as the defect-introducing change.
Summary:
To build a change risk model, they use a wide range of factors based on the
characteristics of a software change, such as the number of added lines, and developer experience.
Outcome:
“Just-In-Time Quality Assurance” may provide an effort-reducing way to focus on
the most risky changes and thus reduce the costs of developing high-quality software.
